intro: Angiopteris arborescens, commonly known as the tree fern, is a species of fern characterized by its tall, trunk-like stem and large, feather-like fronds. It belongs to the family Athyriaceae and is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the world. The plant has a distinctive appearance with a central stem covered in a fibrous sheath and fronds that can grow up to several meters in length. It is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and can thrive in shaded, moist environments. Angiopteris arborescens plays an important ecological role in its native habitats, providing shelter and food for various organisms.
